text.p: Grain and oilseed exports reported by USDA and private export sources.

CORN SALE - The Commodity Credit Corp of the U.S. Agriculture Department said it bought 4,620 tonnes of No. 2 or better yellow corn for donation to Guatemala. It paid $130.89 per tonne, FOB, to Cargill Inc. Shipment is for April 3-27.

WHEAT SALE - The United States is providing Sri Lanka $10 million in long-term, low-interest aid to buy about 55,000 tonnes of wheat, the U.S. embassy in Colombo said. The quantity represents some six percent of the country's annual wheat imports, it said in a statement.

SOY TENDER - The Taichung division of Taiwan's Breakfast Soybean Procurement Association has delayed to Friday its planned Thursday tender for 54,000 tonnes of soybeans and eliminated the United States as a source, traders said. The tender, which had specified U.S. or Argentine soybeans when announced on Wednesday, was revised to include Brazil as a possible source.

WHEAT TENDER - France will hold a tender on March 26 to sell 3,000 tonnes of soft wheat to Iraq via the Rome-based World Food Programme, national grain office ONIC said. The wheat is for shipment in bulk and in bags between April 8 and April 30.
- Iraq is tendering on March 21 for another 50,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for May shipment, the exporters said.

- India's State Trading Corporation (STC) has tendered for 50,000 tonnes of wheat imports for arrival in the post-monsoon season from September onwards, a senior STC official told Reuters on Wednesday.
CORN TENDER - Taiwan's Members Feed Industry Group has moved to Friday a tender initially set for Thursday for up to 112,000 tonnes of U.S. No.2 or Argentine corn, traders said on Wednesday.
VEGOIL TENDER - Egypt was seeking up to 45,000 tonnes of assorted vegetable oils for delivery in May 1997. The deadline for all bids was on April 2.
BARLEY TENDER - The South African Wheat Board said it was offering 25,150 tonnes of feed grade barley for export sale no later than April 30.

RICE TENDER - Syria seeks 12,000 tonnes of white rice for shipment between April 20 and May 20, a company spokesman said. April 8 is the final date for bids, and results will be announced on April 16.
- Costa Rica will seek on March 19 a total of 30,000 tonnes optional origin rough rice which would likely be from the United States or Argentina, U.S. exporters and trade sources said.

MARKET TALK - Malaysia will be looking to buy at least 90,000 tonnes of corn for the May/July period but its buyers are shying away because prices remain a shade too high, regional traders said....Taiwan grain buyers estimated on Thursday that a disease-linked ban on pork exports would cause the island's imports of feed corn to fall by about one-fifth....South Africa's maize crop will be almost two million tonnes smaller than last season, dashing hopes of another bumper harvest and strong export earnings for the country.
